terms.definition: The RootServer application that provides infrastructure, DI services, lifecycle management, and routing for modules and plugins.
terms.disambiguation: Distinct from ASP.NET Core 'host' - refers to the application-level container

terms.definition: Self-contained extension implementing specific functionality (e.g., Airtable integration). Plugins follow the cross-layer pattern but only implement needed layers.
Planned infrastructure for shared services and contracts. Currently minimal implementation in Shared/_Modules.
The 00_Core â†’ 09_Panels organizational pattern for UI components, moving from foundational primitives to composed layouts.
A numbered folder (00-09) representing a level of abstraction in the component hierarchy.
Component naming convention (F_, P_, A_, C_, PNL_, etc.) indicating role and layer assignment.
UI and behavior generated from JSON metadata rather than hardcoded implementations.
Internal tooling in Shared/_Editor for browsing tables, inspecting data, managing Airtable sync, and workspace navigation.
Public-facing website architecture in Shared/_Sites using section-based composition for page rendering.
Scoped service managing pointer/selection state across the application. Central to interaction patterns.
Scoped service managing editor view state and navigation.
Scoped service controlling visibility of editor UI elements.
Scoped service for capturing and displaying log messages within the editor environment.
Primary plugin implementation providing Airtable API integration with local JSON caching.
Local storage of Airtable data as JSON files to enable offline development and reduce API calls.
Detected duplication of JSON files with different naming conventions (e.g., pages.json vs pagesJson.json).
Form input component in the 02_Fields layer. Handles read/write user input.
Interaction helper component in the 03_Pointers layer. Manages selection, navigation, bookmarks.
User or system action component in the 04_Actions layer. Triggers state changes, API calls, sync operations.
Composed layout in the 06_Components layer. Combines fields, pointers, actions into reusable units.
High-level layout container in the 09_Panels layer. Groups multiple views and provides navigation shell.
Planned infrastructure for plugin-to-plugin communication via node-based workflows. Currently experimental.
Content section in Shared/_Sites architecture. Modular page building block for public website.
UI component framework providing Bootstrap 5 and Tailwind CSS integration for Blazor.
DI service lifetime scoped to a single user request/connection in Blazor Server.

synonym_groups.note: Use 'Host' in architectural discussions, 'RootServer' when referring to the specific project
Use 'Cross-Layer Hierarchy' in formal descriptions, '00-09' when referring to folder names

contextual_notes.prefix_formatting: Always include underscore: F_, not F
contextual_notes.file_extensions: .razor for UI components, .cs for code-behind or pure C#
contextual_notes.path_separators: Use forward slashes in documentation: Shared/_Core/02_Fields
